title: 113_s205
content: The Act may be cited as the "Responsible Consumer Financial Protection Regulations Act of 2013" and establishes the Commission. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to establish a Commission as the head of the Bureau with the authority to prescribe regulations and issue orders necessary for carrying out the Act. The Commission established under the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 consists of 5 members appointed by the President with Senate approval. Members must be U.S. citizens with expertise in consumer financial protection and serve staggered 5-year terms. The Commission established under the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 consists of 5 members appointed by the President with Senate approval. Members, including the Chair, serve for 5-year terms and can only be removed for inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance. Vacancies are filled for the remainder of the term, and members can continue to serve until a successor is appointed and confirmed. Members of the Commission appointed by the President serve for 5-year terms and can only be removed for specific reasons. They are prohibited from engaging in other employment during their term. The Chair of the Commission is appointed by the President and serves as the principal executive officer of the Bureau. The Chair of the Commission, appointed by the President, serves as the principal executive officer of the Bureau and is responsible for the appointment and supervision of personnel, distribution of business, and use of funds. The Chair operates under the general policies of the Commission. The Chair of the Commission, appointed by the President, operates under the general policies of the Commission. Requests for appropriations must have prior approval from the Commission. Vacancies in the Commission's membership do not impair the remaining members' powers. Three members constitute a quorum, but with only 3 members due to vacancies, 2 members suffice. The Commission requires 2 members for a quorum. The Chair receives compensation at level I of the Executive Schedule, while other members receive compensation at level II. The Commission requires 2 members for a quorum, with one member initially constituting a quorum. After confirming at least 2 additional commissioners, the quorum requirements of subsection (f) apply. The Bureau will now be included in the regular appropriations process. Section 1017 of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to restructure budget, financial management, and audit provisions, including authorization of appropriations. Subsections (b), (c), and (d) are removed, and subsection (e) is redesignated as subsection (b). Authorization of appropriations for the Bureau under the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 includes $143,000,000 for fiscal year 2013 and $329,000,000 for fiscal year 2014. SEC. 4 amends the Consumer Financial Protection Act to include consideration of the impact of rules on the financial safety of insured depository institutions. SEC. 5 makes conforming amendments. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director with the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director with the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection. Additionally, certain sections are modified to reflect changes in titles within the Bureau. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director with the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection. Certain sections are modified to reflect changes in titles within the Bureau, such as replacing "Assistant director" with "Head of the office" and "Director of the Bureau" with "Chair of the Commission". The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act is also amended accordingly. The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act is amended to replace references to the Director with the Chair of the Commission. Similarly, the Electronic Fund Transfer Act and Expedited Funds Availability Act are modified to replace "Director of the Bureau" with "Bureau" and "Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection" respectively. The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director with the Bureau. The Federal Deposit Insurance Act and Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act are also amended to replace "Director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau" with "Chair of the Commission of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection". The Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to replace references to the Director with the Bureau in various acts such as the Financial Literacy and Education Improvement Act and the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975. The Interstate Land Sales Full Disclosure Act is also amended accordingly. The Sales Full Disclosure Act and the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act are amended to replace references to the Director with the Chair of the Commission of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection. The S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 and Title 44, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Director with the Bureau.
